result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary Colin Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Give a DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Court found Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
- Complete a parenting class.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with Crystal M. and Clara K. UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to No Violent Contact.
- Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain/maintain employment or attend school.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Zachary Colin Thompson in court PRO SE.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Reflects 01-22-16 Court order imposing 2 days of condition time.

Defendant Zachary Colin Thompson in court PRO SE.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 2 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed. Another date needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zachary Colin Thompson in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zachary Colin Thompson in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Zachary Colin Thompson in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 26 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 10/23/15.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with Crystal M. and Clara K. UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment or attend school.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Give a DNA sample; pay the surcharge.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zachary Colin Thompson in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Zachary Colin Thompson in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zachary Colin Thompson in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Zachary Colin Thompson in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 40
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Defense counsel requested an additional bail review. Matter adjourned to branch 40  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact/NO FIREARMS Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CRYSTAL M. AND CLARA K.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for Zachary Colin Thompson
Current: 2726 W LAPHAM ST APT 203, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 06-28-2015)
Prior: 2114 South  23rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Defendant Zachary Colin Thompson in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Zachary Colin Thompson in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 40.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
